properties.areaDesc: Wood, WV; Morgan, OH; Meigs, OH; Athens, OH; Washington, OH
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 4:29PM EST until January 25 at 1:30AM EST by NWS Charleston WV
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Charleston West Virginia has issued a

* Flood Warning for...
Northern Meigs County in southeastern Ohio...
Washington County in southeastern Ohio...
Southwestern Morgan County in southeastern Ohio...
Athens County in southeastern Ohio...
Wood County in northwestern West Virginia...

* Until 130 AM EST Saturday.

* At 423 PM EST, a trained weather spotter reported small streams
bankfull in the Lubeck and Washington area in Wood County that
could come out of their banks and cause flooding. Other area
streams were rising quickly in response to up to one inch of rain
which fell overnight and today. The Ohio department of
transportation reported road closures and restrictions in Athens
county west of Athens.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Parkersburg, Athens, Marietta, Belpre, Nelsonville, Glouster,
Beverly, Albany, Coolville, Chesterhill, Forked Run State Park,
Vienna, Williamstown, Washington, Mineralwells, Tuppers Plains,
Lubeck, Boaz, Chester and Chauncey.

Additional rainfall amounts of up to one half inch are possible in
the warned area.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small
creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses
as well as other drainage areas, country roads, farmland and
other low lying spots.

Please report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling
toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.

You may also report flooding by posting your report to the Charleston
West Virginia National Weather Service Facebook Page, or by using the
Twitter Hashtag, NWSRLX.
